newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Thailand IOT in 5-year plan to renew tanker fleet.
newsitem.headline: Thailand IOT in 5-year plan to renew tanker fleet.

text.p: Thailand's private oil trading firm International Oil Tanking Pte Ltd (IOT) is planning to renew its medium-range tanker fleet over the next five years, a company source said on Tuesday.
IOT has informed shipping brokers of its intention to sell all six of its 30,000-tonne tankers over the next few years and to replace them with younger vessels, the source said.
"We are trying to reduce the overall age of our fleet to around 15 years," the source said.
But the company has no plans to commission the building of new tankers. "We are not building new ships," he said.
Currently, IOT's 17-vessel fleet age, including one 320,000-tonne ultra large crude carrier (ULCC) and two very large crude carriers (VLCC), are about 20 years old.
The average age of IOT's medium-range fleet is between 21 and 22 years and the company is looking to buy newer tankers of between 12 and 15 years, he said.
IOT uses its fleet of medium and long range vessels to transport mainly middle distillates from the Middle East to Thailand, China and other Southeast Asian countries.
It has also been using its large carriers as floating storage off Singapore or Fujairah in the United Arab Emirates to augment its trading positions.
The company recently expanded its trading activities to include fuel oil but this is still a small part of its total business, the source said.
Of the 17-vessels, one VLCC and two long-range vessels are dedicated as dirty tankers, he said.
